Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Gange \Gange\ (g[a^]nj), v. t. [imp. & p. p. {Ganged} (g[a^]njd); p. pr. & vb. n. {Ganging} (g[a^]n"j[i^]ng).] [Of uncertain origin.] 1. To protect (the part of a line next a fishhook, or the hook itself) by winding it with wire. [Webster 1913 Suppl.]
2. To attach (a fishhook) to a line or snell, as by knotting the line around the shank of the hook. [Webster 1913 Suppl.]
